summary:
I am an adventurous and curious individual that is driven by discovery, growth, and making a contribution to life. I enjoy research and development and in the past this led me to pursue a PhD (Center for Wave Phenomena at Colorado School of Mines) and a postdoc (Princeton University) in seismology, and a career in various roles in the oil and gas industry, the most recent being a research manager in Rio de Janeiro in Brazil, where I setup an R&D team of 5 local contract researchers and developers from the ground up.

Nowadays, it is obvious that artificial intelligence (AI) and new developments in computation will fundamentally change the way we live in the coming decades. Meanwhile, due to the ongoing move towards sustainable energy, the oil industry will be faced with increased price pressure in the long term. In my current position, the aim is to benefit from new developments in AI and computation to improve cost-efficiency in subsurface technology for the exploration and monitoring of natural resources. 

When not working I can be found on my bike, in/on/near the water, or making music.

Setup a research program for the group as well as a collaboration with Delft University of Technology. The research and development aimed mostly at making an impact on imaging and reservoir characterisation for pre-salt reservoirs offshore Brazil. Topics included Marchenko imaging with internal multiples, seismic reservoir characterisation (forward modelling and inversion) that accounts for illumination variations using Point Spread Functions, dynamic warping of seismic data based on an eikonal solver, 3D isotropic fast-marching eikonal solver, and hybrid finite-frequency traveltime and waveform inversion (i.e. full waveform inversion using both travel times and amplitudes). Helped change the culture at the Rio center from a lower tech to a higher-tech processing shop through close collaboration with the production group, organising a technical seminar, establishing a presence at local and international conferences through writing of conference abstracts, teaching presentation skills, helping with the hiring of new seismic processors as well as all technical-related management of the center, and challenging the status quo. The focus was on leading by example. Prepared and gave several well-received presentations at Petrobras on various R&D topics, including an invited talk on envisioning the future of seismic technology in 2040 at a workshop organised by Petrobras. The talk was recognised as the best presentation of the workshop.', 'title': 'Research Manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 15031, 'name': 'ION Geophysical', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGmnWeYR8is2Q/company-logo_400_400/0/1617812366658?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=AFY3CD1cNzTDajNt2hVEvTPOJngS9RYRoWAdnZhG-68', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/iongeo/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Princeton, New Jersey, USA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'ION GEO', 'description': 'Research and development on various topics, including (but not limited to) finite-frequency travel time tomography (aka full-waveform inversion with travel times), adjoint-state methods, semblance-based interval VTI parameter estimation, surface-wave (Rayleigh and Love wave) forward modelling and inversion, surface-wave removal,   seismic interferometry, eikonal tomography and vibrator ground-motion analysis.
